newsitem.title: UK: BFI down three at 992, some Panamax activity seen.
newsitem.headline: BFI down three at 992, some Panamax activity seen.

text.p: The Baltic Freight Index (BFI) was down three at 992 points on Tuesday although brokers reported stronger demand and more activity for Panamax tonnage than seen so far this month, especially in the Pacific.

But Chinese controlled Panamax tonnage has fixed weaker heavy grain rates from the US Gulf to three destinations - lumpsum equivalent of $8 to Rotterdam (Bunge), $17.70 to Taiwan (Halla) and $17 to Aqaba (Continental), all for loading up to mid-October.
BIFFEX reflected the increased Panamax activity with gains of between 18 and 14 points in the active positions where turnover totalled 196 lots.
